comments:
If an annotation processor tries to generate a class file in package, such as
with createClassFile("foo.Bar") where the package "foo" does not exist, the file
won't be created and a FileNotFoundException will be thrown.  If the package
"foo" does exist, the file will be created without any problems.


Repro:
1. Add the test jar from bug 113924 to a project, then add it to the factory path.
2. Note that if your project already contains a package called "pkgC" the bug
won't repro.
3. In a file in the project, add a usage of @ClassGenAnnotation, and save.


Two files should be generated in the bin directory:  ClassFile1.class and
pkgC/ClassFile2.class.  However, only the file at the root is created, not the
one in the package.  Also get the following exception in the console:


java.io.FileNotFoundException:
D:\eclipse_jdt\runtime-EclipseApplication\TestProject\bin\classpackage\ClassFilePkg.class
(The system cannot find the path specified)

Needed to create any missing subdirectories on class file creation.
Fixed long ago.  The original repro case still runs properly with no errors.  Marking as Verified.
